topics.body: Well I feel incredibly stupid; I was wondering for the longest time why wifi wouldn't work on my laptop cause it kept saying that the wifi card was disabled by the wifi switch and the so called switch was actually a button that gives off light to detect detected hardware.  I know that was kind of dumb of me, but who designs the detector light to double as a peripheral?  That would be like having a button on your dash to turn on your car but at the same time the button only lights up if your battery is charged.  On the one hand that was kind of dumb of me; on the other hand that's kind of dumb computer design.
